title: Backend: Setup database schema and models
body:
## Description
Create database schema and Entity Framework Core models for the Car Maintenance Tracker application.

## Models to Create
1. **MaintenanceItemTemplate**
   - id (int, PK, auto-generated)
   - name (string, required)
   - intervalType (string, required, 'km' or 'time')
   - intervalValue (int, required)
   - archived (bool, default: false)
   - createdAt (datetime, auto-generated)

2. **Car**
   - id (int, PK, auto-generated)
   - name (string, required)
   - currentKm (int, required)
   - createdAt (datetime, auto-generated)

3. **CarMaintenanceItem**
   - id (int, PK, auto-generated)
   - carId (int, FK to Car)
   - maintenanceTemplateId (int, FK to MaintenanceItemTemplate)
   - lastServiceKm (int, nullable)
   - lastServiceDate (datetime, nullable)
   - intervalValue (int, required)
   - intervalType (string, required)
   - calculatedNextKm (int, computed)
   - calculatedNextDate (datetime, computed)

4. **TrackChange**
   - id (int, PK, auto-generated)
   - carMaintenanceItemId (int, FK to CarMaintenanceItem)
   - km (int, nullable)
   - date (datetime, nullable)

## Tasks
- [ ] Setup .NET 8 Web API project
- [ ] Install Entity Framework Core and SQL Server packages
- [ ] Create DbContext
- [ ] Create model classes
- [ ] Configure relationships and constraints
- [ ] Create initial migration
- [ ] Apply migration to database

## Technology
- .NET 8 Web API
- Entity Framework Core
- SQL Server

title: Backend: Implement GET /setup endpoint
body:
## Description
Implement backend endpoint to retrieve list of maintenance item templates.

## Endpoint Details
- **Method:** GET
- **Path:** `/setup`
- **Response:** List of MaintenanceItemTemplate objects

## Requirements
- Return all non-archived templates by default
- Sort by createdAt descending (newest first)
- Return JSON array of templates

## Response Example
```json
[
  {
    "id": 1,
    "name": "Oil Change",
    "intervalType": "km",
    "intervalValue": 10000,
    "archived": false,
    "createdAt": "2026-01-15T10:30:00Z"
  }
]
```

## Tasks
- [ ] Create SetupController
- [ ] Implement GET /setup action
- [ ] Add query to filter non-archived templates
- [ ] Add sorting by createdAt descending
- [ ] Test endpoint with Swagger

## Technology
- .NET 8 Web API
- Entity Framework Core

title: Backend: Implement POST /setup endpoint
body:
## Description
Implement backend endpoint to create a new maintenance item template.

## Endpoint Details
- **Method:** POST
- **Path:** `/setup`
- **Request Body:** MaintenanceItemTemplate (without id, createdAt, archived)

## Request Body Example
```json
{
  "name": "Oil Change",
  "intervalType": "km",
  "intervalValue": 10000
}
```

## Requirements
- Validate required fields (name, intervalType, intervalValue)
- Validate intervalType is either 'km' or 'time'
- Validate intervalValue > 0
- Auto-generate id and createdAt
- Set archived to false by default
- Return created template with 201 status

## Tasks
- [ ] Create POST action in SetupController
- [ ] Add model validation
- [ ] Save to database
- [ ] Return created entity
- [ ] Test with Swagger

## Technology
- .NET 8 Web API
- Entity Framework Core

title: Backend: Implement PUT /setup/{id} endpoint
body:
## Description
Implement backend endpoint to update an existing maintenance item template.

## Endpoint Details
- **Method:** PUT
- **Path:** `/setup/{id}`
- **Path Parameter:** id (int) - Template ID
- **Request Body:** Updated template fields

## Request Body Example
```json
{
  "name": "Oil Change Updated",
  "intervalType": "time",
  "intervalValue": 365
}
```

## Requirements
- Find template by id
- Return 404 if not found
- Validate all fields
- Update only provided fields
- Preserve createdAt and id
- Return updated template

## Tasks
- [ ] Create PUT action in SetupController
- [ ] Add template lookup logic
- [ ] Add validation
- [ ] Update entity
- [ ] Test with Swagger

## Technology
- .NET 8 Web API
- Entity Framework Core

title: Frontend: Setup React application with Vite and Tailwind CSS
body:
## Description
Initialize the frontend React application with Vite, Tailwind CSS, and routing.

## Requirements
- Create React app using Vite
- Install and configure Tailwind CSS
- Setup react-router-dom for routing
- Install Axios for API calls
- Create basic app structure

## Routes to Setup
- `/setup` - Maintenance templates page
- `/cars` - Cars list page
- `/cars/new` - Add new car page
- `/cars/{id}/edit` - Edit car page
- `/dashboard` - Dashboard page

## Tasks
- [ ] Run `npm create vite@latest` with React template
- [ ] Install Tailwind CSS
- [ ] Configure Tailwind in project
- [ ] Install react-router-dom
- [ ] Install Axios
- [ ] Setup basic routing structure
- [ ] Create Layout component
- [ ] Create navigation menu
- [ ] Test routing works

## Technology
- React (JavaScript)
- Vite
- Tailwind CSS
- react-router-dom
- Axios

title: Frontend: Create Setup page - Add Template functionality
body:
## Description
Implement functionality to add new maintenance item templates on the `/setup` page.

## Features

  - Name (text input, required)
  - Interval Type (dropdown: km/time, required)
  - Interval Value (number input, required, label changes based on type)
- Save and Cancel buttons
- Validation:
  - Name required: "Name is obligatory field"
  - Interval Type required: "Interval type is obligatory field"
  - Interval Value required: "Interval value is obligatory field"
  - Interval Value must be > 0
- Highlight invalid fields in red
- On success, add to list and clear form
- On cancel, hide form without saving

## Tasks
- [ ] Create AddTemplate component/form
- [ ] Add "Add Template" button
- [ ] Implement form state management
- [ ] Add validation logic
- [ ] Implement POST /setup API call
- [ ] Handle success and error responses
- [ ] Update template list after creation
- [ ] Style form with Tailwind CSS
- [ ] Test complete flow

## API Integration
- **Endpoint:** POST /setup
- **Backend URL:** Will be configured via Docker environment

## Technology
- React
- Tailwind CSS
- Axios

title: Backend: Implement GET /cars endpoint
body:
## Description
Implement backend endpoint to retrieve list of cars with their maintenance items.

## Endpoint Details
- **Method:** GET
- **Path:** `/cars`
- **Response:** List of Cars with attached CarMaintenanceItems

## Requirements
- Return all cars sorted by createdAt descending
- Include non-archived maintenance items for each car
- Include calculated next service km/date
- Sort maintenance items by createdAt descending

## Response Example
```json
[
  {
    "id": 1,
    "name": "Honda Civic",
    "currentKm": 50000,
    "createdAt": "2026-01-15T10:30:00Z",
    "maintenanceItems": [
      {
        "id": 1,
        "maintenanceTemplateId": 1,
        "templateName": "Oil Change",
        "intervalType": "km",
        "intervalValue": 10000,
        "lastServiceKm": 45000,
        "calculatedNextKm": 55000
      }
    ]
  }
]
```

## Tasks
- [ ] Create CarsController
- [ ] Implement GET /cars action
- [ ] Add query to include maintenance items
- [ ] Filter non-archived items
- [ ] Add sorting logic
- [ ] Calculate next service values
- [ ] Test endpoint with Swagger

## Technology
- .NET 8 Web API
- Entity Framework Core

title: Backend: Implement POST /trackchange/{carMaintenanceItemId} endpoint
body:
## Description
Implement backend endpoint to record a maintenance change for a car maintenance item.

## Endpoint Details
- **Method:** POST
- **Path:** `/trackchange/{carMaintenanceItemId}`
- **Path Parameter:** carMaintenanceItemId (int)
- **Request Body:** Change details (km or date)

## Request Body Example
```json
{
  "km": 52000
}
```
or
```json
{
  "date": "2026-02-15"
}
```

## Requirements
- Find CarMaintenanceItem by id (404 if not found)
- Create TrackChange record
- Update lastServiceKm or lastServiceDate in CarMaintenanceItem
- Recalculate next service km/date
- Return updated maintenance item

## Logic
- If intervalType is 'km', update lastServiceKm
- If intervalType is 'time', update lastServiceDate
- calculatedNextKm = lastServiceKm + intervalValue
- calculatedNextDate = lastServiceDate + intervalValue (days)

## Tasks
- [ ] Create TrackChangeController
- [ ] Implement POST action
- [ ] Add item lookup logic
- [ ] Create TrackChange record
- [ ] Update CarMaintenanceItem
- [ ] Recalculate next service
- [ ] Test with Swagger

## Technology
- .NET 8 Web API
- Entity Framework Core

title: Backend: Implement GET /dashboard/{carId} endpoint
body:
## Description
Implement backend endpoint to retrieve dashboard data for a specific car with maintenance items grouped by status.

## Endpoint Details
- **Method:** GET
- **Path:** `/dashboard/{carId}`
- **Path Parameter:** carId (int) - Car ID

## Response Example
```json
{
  "car": {
    "id": 1,
    "name": "Honda Civic",
    "currentKm": 52000
  },
  "maintenanceGroups": {
    "overdue": [
      {
        "id": 1,
        "name": "Oil Change",
        "intervalType": "km",
        "intervalValue": 10000,
        "lastServiceKm": 45000,
        "calculatedNextKm": 55000,
        "status": "overdue",
        "daysUntilDue": null,
        "kmUntilDue": -2000
      }
    ],
    "dueSoon": [],
    "ok": []
  }
}
```

## Status Calculation Logic
- **Km-based:**
  - Overdue: currentKm >= calculatedNextKm
  - Due Soon: calculatedNextKm - currentKm <= 300
  - OK: calculatedNextKm - currentKm > 300
- **Time-based:**
  - Overdue: today >= calculatedNextDate
  - Due Soon: calculatedNextDate - today <= 30 days
  - OK: calculatedNextDate - today > 30 days

## Tasks
- [ ] Create DashboardController
- [ ] Implement GET /dashboard/{carId} action
- [ ] Add car lookup with maintenance items
- [ ] Implement status calculation logic
- [ ] Group items by status
- [ ] Calculate kmUntilDue / daysUntilDue
- [ ] Test with Swagger

## Technology
- .NET 8 Web API
- Entity Framework Core

title: Frontend: Create Add Car page (/cars/new)
body:
## Description
Create the `/cars/new` page to add a new car with maintenance items.

## Features
- Form to add car:
  - Car Name (text input, required)
  - Current Mileage/Km (number input, required)
- Load all templates from GET /setup
- For each template, show editable fields:
  - Template name (read-only)
  - Interval (number, default from template, editable, required)
  - Last service (km or date based on intervalType, required)
  - Date input: masked input dd/mm/yyyy
  - Km input: number >= 0
- Validation:
  - All required fields
  - Date format: dd/mm/yyyy (dd â‰¤ 31, mm â‰¤ 12, yyyy â‰¥ 2000)
  - Km must be >= 0
  - Interval must be > 0
- Save button: POST to /cars
- Cancel button: navigate back to /cars
- On success: redirect to /cars

## Tasks
- [ ] Create AddCarPage component
- [ ] Create masked date input component
- [ ] Load templates from GET /setup
- [ ] Build form with car and maintenance fields
- [ ] Add validation logic
- [ ] Implement POST /cars API call
- [ ] Handle success (redirect) and error
- [ ] Style with Tailwind CSS
- [ ] Test complete flow

## API Integration
- **Endpoint:** GET /setup (to load templates)
- **Endpoint:** POST /cars (to create car)
- **Backend URL:** Will be configured via Docker environment

## Technology
- React
- Tailwind CSS
- Axios
- react-router-dom

title: DevOps: Create Dockerfile for backend
body:

title: DevOps: Create docker-compose.yml
body:
## Description
Create docker-compose.yml to orchestrate all services (frontend, backend, database).

## Services
1. **database** - SQL Server
   - Use official SQL Server image
   - Configure password and database name
   - Persist data with volume
   - Internal network

2. **backend** - .NET Web API
   - Build from Dockerfile
   - Expose API port
   - Connect to database
   - Wait for database to be ready
   - Environment variables for connection string

3. **frontend** - React app
   - Build from Dockerfile
   - Expose port 80/443
   - Environment variable for backend API URL
   - Depends on backend

## Network Configuration
- Backend API URL: http://backend:8080
- Frontend will proxy API calls or use CORS

## Tasks
- [ ] Create docker-compose.yml in root
- [ ] Define database service
- [ ] Define backend service
- [ ] Define frontend service
- [ ] Configure networks
- [ ] Configure volumes
- [ ] Set environment variables
- [ ] Test docker-compose up
- [ ] Test all services communicate
- [ ] Document environment variables

## Technology
- Docker Compose
- SQL Server
- .NET 8
- React

title: Documentation: Create README with setup instructions
body:
## Description
Create comprehensive README with project overview and setup instructions.

## Content to Include
- Project description
- Features overview
- Technology stack
- Prerequisites (Docker, Docker Compose)
- Setup instructions:
  - Clone repository
  - Run with Docker Compose
  - Access frontend and backend
  - API documentation (Swagger)
- Project structure
- API endpoints reference
- Development setup (without Docker)
- Environment variables reference
- Contributing guidelines

## Tasks
- [ ] Create/update README.md
- [ ] Add project description
- [ ] Add setup instructions
- [ ] Document environment variables
- [ ] Add API endpoints summary
- [ ] Add screenshots (optional)
- [ ] Add troubleshooting section

## Technology
- Markdown

title: Testing: Backend unit tests for core business logic
body:
## Description
Create unit tests for backend business logic (optional, good practice).

## Test Coverage
- Next service calculation logic
- Status calculation logic
- Date parsing and validation
- Model validation

## Tasks

- [ ] Create tests for calculation methods
- [ ] Create tests for status determination
- [ ] Create tests for validation
- [ ] Run tests and ensure they pass

- xUnit
- .NET 8

title: Frontend: Create reusable components library
body:
## Description
Create a library of reusable UI components to maintain consistency.

## Components to Create
- Button (primary, secondary, danger)
- Input (text, number, date)
- Modal/Dialog
- Card
- Dropdown/Select
- Loading Spinner
- Error Message
- Confirmation Dialog
- Form components (FormField, FormGroup)

## Tasks
- [ ] Create components directory structure
- [ ] Implement Button component
- [ ] Implement Input component
- [ ] Implement Modal component
- [ ] Implement Card component
- [ ] Implement Dropdown component
- [ ] Implement Loading Spinner
- [ ] Implement Error Message
- [ ] Style with Tailwind CSS
- [ ] Document component props

## Technology
- React
- Tailwind CSS

title: Frontend: Create masked date input component
body:
## Description
Create a reusable masked date input component for dd/mm/yyyy format.

## Features
- Auto-format as user types
- Mask: dd/mm/yyyy
- Validation:
  - dd: 01-31
  - mm: 01-12
  - yyyy: >= 2000
- Visual feedback for invalid input
- Error messages
- Integration with form state

## Tasks
- [ ] Create MaskedDateInput component
- [ ] Implement masking logic
- [ ] Add validation
- [ ] Add error display
- [ ] Style with Tailwind CSS
- [ ] Test various date inputs
- [ ] Document usage

## Technology
- React
- Tailwind CSS

title: Backend: Add CORS configuration
body:
## Description
Configure CORS to allow frontend to communicate with backend API.

## Requirements
- Allow frontend origin (configure via environment)
- Allow credentials
- Allow common HTTP methods (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE)
- Allow common headers

## Tasks
- [ ] Add CORS service in Program.cs
- [ ] Configure allowed origins
- [ ] Configure allowed methods
- [ ] Configure allowed headers
- [ ] Test from frontend

## Technology
- .NET 8 Web API
- CORS middleware

title: Backend: Add error handling middleware
body:
## Description
Implement global error handling middleware for consistent error responses.

## Features
- Catch all unhandled exceptions
- Return consistent error response format
- Log errors
- Return appropriate HTTP status codes
- Hide sensitive details in production

## Error Response Format
```json
{
  "error": "Error message",
  "statusCode": 400,
  "timestamp": "2026-02-16T10:30:00Z"
}
```

## Tasks
- [ ] Create error handling middleware
- [ ] Add exception handling
- [ ] Format error responses
- [ ] Add logging
- [ ] Register middleware in Program.cs
- [ ] Test error scenarios

## Technology
- .NET 8 Web API
- Middleware

title: Frontend: Add error handling and loading states
body:
## Description
Implement consistent error handling and loading states across all pages.

## Features
- Loading spinners during API calls
- Error messages with retry option
- Toast notifications for success/error
- Network error handling
- 404 error pages

## Tasks
- [ ] Create ErrorBoundary component
- [ ] Create Toast notification component
- [ ] Add loading states to all API calls
- [ ] Add error handling to all API calls
- [ ] Create 404 page
- [ ] Test error scenarios

- React
- Tailwind CSS

title: Backend: Add logging configuration
body:
## Description
Configure logging for the backend application.

## Requirements
- Log to console in development
- Log to file in production
- Configure log levels
- Log API requests
- Log errors

title: Frontend: Add API service layer
body:
## Description
Create a service layer to centralize API calls and configuration.

## Features
- Single source for API URL configuration
- Axios instance with defaults
- Error handling
- Request/response interceptors
- Service methods for each endpoint

- SetupService (template endpoints)
- CarsService (car endpoints)
- TrackChangeService

title: DevOps: Add .dockerignore files
body:

- build/
- *.md

title: DevOps: Add .gitignore
body:
## Description
Create comprehensive .gitignore file for the project.

## Ignore Patterns
- .NET: bin/, obj/, *.user
- React: node_modules/, dist/, build/
- IDEs: .vs/, .vscode/, .idea/
- Environment: .env, .env.local
- Docker: volumes/
- Database: *.db

## Tasks
- [ ] Create .gitignore in root
- [ ] Add .NET patterns
- [ ] Add React patterns
- [ ] Add Docker patterns
- [ ] Test ignored files

## Technology
- Git
